metadata.titleEn: Dataset of Heihe integrated observatory network (automatic weather station of Heihe remote sensing station, 2023)
metadata.titleCn: 黑河流域地表过程综合观测网（黑河遥感站自动气象站-2023）
metadata.description:
This dataset includes data recorded by the Heihe integrated observatory network obtained from the automatic weather station (AWS) at the observation system of Heihe remote sensing station from January 1 to December 31, 2023. The site (100.4756° E, 38.8270° N) was located on artificial grassland in Dangzhai Town of Zhangye, Gansu Province. The elevation is 1560 m. The installation heights and orientations of different sensors and measured quantities were as follows: air temperature and humidity profile (1.5 m, north), wind speed and direction (10 m, north), air pressure (2 m), rain gauge (0.7 m), four-component radiometer (1.5 m, south), two infrared temperature sensors (1.5 m, south, vertically downward), soil heat flux (3 duplicates, -0.06 m), soil temperature profile (0, -0.02, -0.04, -0.1, -0.2, -0.4, -0.8, -1.2, -1.6 m), soil moisture profile (-0.02, -0.04, -0.1, -0.2, -0.4, -0.8, -1.2, -1.6 m), and two photosynthetically active radiation (1.5 m, south, one vertically downward and one vertically upward).
The observations included the following: air temperature and humidity (Ta_1.5, RH_1.5 m) (℃ and %, respectively), wind speed (Ws_10 m) (m/s), wind direction (WD_10 m) (°), air pressure (press) (hpa), precipitation (rain) (mm), four-component radiation (DR, incoming shortwave radiation; UR, outgoing shortwave radiation; DLR_Cor, incoming longwave radiation; ULR_Cor, outgoing longwave radiation; Rn, net radiation) (W/m^2), infrared temperature (IRT_1 and IRT_2) (℃), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2, and Gs_3) (W/m^2), soil temperature (Ts_0 cm, Ts_2 cm, Ts_4 cm, Ts_10 cm, Ts_20 cm, Ts_40 cm, Ts_80 cm, Ts_120 cm, Ts_160 cm) (℃), soil moisture (Ms_2 cm, Ms_4 cm, Ms_10 cm, Ms_20 cm, Ms_40 cm, Ms_80 cm, Ms_120 cm, Ms_160 cm) (℃),on the plants photosynthetically active radiation of upward and downward (PAR_U_up and PAR_U_down) (μmol/ (s m2)).
The data processing and quality control steps were as follows: (1) The AWS data were averaged over intervals of 10 min for a total of 144 records per day. The missing data were denoted by -6999. (2) Data in duplicate records were rejected. (3) Unphysical data were rejected. (4) The data marked in red are problematic data. (5) The format of the date and time was unified, and the date and time were collected in the same column, for example, date and time: 2023-6-10 10:30. (6) Finally, the naming convention was AWS+ site no. Moreover, suspicious data were marked in red.
For more information, please refer to Liu et al. (2018) and Liu et al. (2023).
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2023年1月1日至2023年12月31日黑河流域地表过程综合观测网中游黑河遥感站气象要素观测数据。站点位于甘肃省张掖市党寨镇东侧，下垫面是人工草地。观测点的经纬度是100.4756E, 38.8270N，海拔1560m。空气温度湿度传感器架设在1.5m处，朝向正北；气压计在防水箱内；翻斗式雨量计安装在0.7 m处；风速风向传感器架设在10m处，朝向正北；四分量辐射仪安装高度为1.5m，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装高度为1.5m，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm、160cm处；土壤水分探头埋设在2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm、160cm处；平均土壤温度探头埋设在2cm和4cm；土壤热流板（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处；两个光合有效辐射仪分别架设在冠层上方1.5m（探头垂直向上和向下方向各一个），朝向正南。
观测项目有：空气温湿度（Ta_1.5m、RH_1.5m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、风速（WS_10m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_10m）(单位：度)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_2cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm、Ts_80cm、Ts_120cm、Ts_160cm）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤水分（Ms_2cm、Ms_4cm、Ms_10cm、Ms_20cm、Ms_40cm、Ms_80cm、Ms_120cm、Ms_160cm）(单位：%)、向上与向下光合有效辐射（PAR_U_up、PAR_U_down）(单位：微摩尔/平方米秒)、平均土壤温度（TCAV）（单位：摄氏度）。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2023-6-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称
黑河综合观测网或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2018)和Liu et al. (2023)。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区大约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其在发展中国家尤为明显（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是其经济发展的基础，尤其是在中国西部，自古以来就是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持着中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，先前的研究发现，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠区域是碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展是非常重要的。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解，对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频发，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013），咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据是通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取的。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度、风速和风向的梯度；以及气压、降水和土壤湿度剖面）是通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期观测的，同时也包括地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站，包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Verification.QuestionEn: Are long-term observations considered indispensable for understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas?
Verification.QuestionCn: 长期观测被认为是理解绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换不可或缺的。

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: What type of data processing technique is more frequently used for ensuring data quality in research involving hydrometeorological measurements: data archiving, data collection, or data processing and quality control?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 在涉及水文气象测量的研究中，确保数据质量的更常用的数据处理技术是什么：数据归档、数据收集还是数据处理和质量控制？

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: Are datasets related to oasis–desert energy and water exchanges more commonly obtained from remote sensing, field observations, or numerical simulations?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 与绿洲-沙漠能量和水交换相关的数据集更常通过遥感、实地观测还是数值模拟获得？

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: What are the data collection methods used in observing energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 在观察绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换时使用的数据收集方法有哪些？
Concept Completion.AnswerEn: eddy covariance system, scintillometer, automatic weather stations
Concept Completion.AnswerCn: 涡度相关系统，闪烁仪，自动气象站

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: What challenges are faced when collecting data in inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区收集内陆河流流域数据时面临哪些挑战？

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used to measure soil temperature and moisture at various depths in arid and semi-arid regions?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个用于测量干旱和半干旱地区不同深度土壤温度和湿度的数据收集方法的示例？
Example.AnswerEn: One example of a data collection method involves embedding soil temperature probes at different depths (0cm, 2cm, 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 80cm, 120cm, 160cm) and soil moisture probes at similar depths (2cm, 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 80cm, 120cm, 160cm) to measure soil temperature and moisture in arid and semi-arid regions.
Example.AnswerCn: 一种数据收集方法涉及在不同深度（0cm、2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm、160cm）埋设土壤温度探头，以及在类似深度（2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm、160cm）埋设土壤湿度探头，以测量干旱和半干旱地区的土壤温度和湿度。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a challenge faced in data collection for ecological environment studies in inland river basins of arid regions?
Example.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区内陆河流流域的生态环境研究中，数据收集面临的一个挑战是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of a challenge in data collection is the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, intensification of land desertification, and frequent occurrence of dust storms in inland river basins like the Tarim River basin, the Aral Sea basin, and the Lake Urmia basin.
Example.AnswerCn: 数据收集中的一个挑战是生态环境退化危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧，以及内陆河流流域如塔里木河流域、咸海流域和乌尔米湖流域频繁发生的沙尘暴。

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a dataset that includes long-term observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个包含绿洲-沙漠地区能源、水汽和碳交换的长期观测数据集的示例？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of such a dataset includes long-term observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes, as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters, collected from 2012 to 2021 in the middle and lower reaches of the HRB. This dataset is available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
Example.AnswerCn: 这样的数据集包括对2012年至2021年间HRB中下游地区的能量、水汽和碳通量的长期观测，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。该数据集可从国家西藏高原数据中心获取。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the characteristics of data collected from the automatic weather stations in the Heihe River Basin?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 黑河流域自动气象站收集的数据特点是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: air temperature and humidity at 1.5m, atmospheric pressure, precipitation, wind speed and direction at 10m, four-component radiation, surface radiation temperature, soil heat flux, soil temperature at various depths, soil moisture at various depths, photosynthetically active radiation above the canopy
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 空气温度和湿度（1.5米处）、大气压力、降水、风速和风向（10米处）、四分量辐射、地表辐射温度、土壤热通量、不同深度的土壤温度、不同深度的土壤湿度、冠层上方的光合有效辐射。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the key features of the observational datasets used to study oasis–desert systems?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 用于研究绿洲-沙漠系统的观测数据集的关键特征是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes, hydrometeorological data, radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, air temperature and humidity gradients, wind speed and direction, air pressure, precipitation, soil moisture profiles, vegetation and soil parameters
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 长期能量、水汽、碳和甲烷通量、水文气象数据、辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面、空气温度和湿度梯度、风速和风向、气压、降水、土壤湿度剖面、植被和土壤参数。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the notable attributes of the data quality control process for meteorological observations in arid regions?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 干旱地区气象观测数据质量控制过程的显著特征有哪些？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: daily completeness with 144 data entries, marking missing data, removing duplicate records, deleting data outside physical meaning or instrument range, unifying date and time formats, highlighting data with uncertainties
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 每日完整性检查，包含144条数据，标记缺失数据，删除重复记录，删除超出物理意义或仪器范围的数据，统一日期和时间格式，突出显示不确定性数据。

Quantification.QuestionEn: How many land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in the arid regions of western China since 2012?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 自2012年以来，在中国西部的干旱地区建立了多少个地表通量和气象站？

Quantification.QuestionEn: How many data points are expected daily from the automatic weather stations based on the processing and quality control procedures?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 根据处理和质量控制程序，自动气象站预计每天会产生多少个数据点？

Definition.QuestionEn: What is an oasis–desert system in the context of arid and semiarid regions?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，绿洲-沙漠系统是指一种生态系统，其中绿洲作为水源和生物多样性的中心，周围则是广袤的沙漠环境。这种系统通常表现出水资源的局部集中和生物群落的多样性，与干燥的沙漠环境形成鲜明对比。
Definition.AnswerEn: An oasis–desert system in arid and semiarid regions refers to a unique ecological landscape where oases, which comprise less than 10% of the total area, support more than 90% of the population in these regions. This system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity, especially in western China.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，绿洲-沙漠系统指的是一种独特的生态景观，其中绿洲占总面积的不到10%，却支持了这些地区90%以上的人口。这个系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用，尤其是在中国西部。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is the importance of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange studies in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Definition.QuestionCn: 能量、水汽和碳交换研究在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的重要性是什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: Understanding the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is crucial for achieving sustainable oasis development, supporting ecological security, and maintaining socioeconomic development. These studies are significant for recognizing oasis–desert interactions, supporting the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality, and protecting the ecological stability.
Definition.AnswerCn: 理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水汽和碳交换对于实现可持续的绿洲发展、支持生态安全和维护社会经济发展至关重要。这些研究对于认识绿洲-沙漠相互作用、支持碳达峰和碳中和目标以及保护生态稳定性具有重要意义。

Definition.QuestionEn: What are the challenges faced by inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas?
Definition.QuestionCn: 干旱和半干旱地区的内陆河流流域面临的挑战有哪些？
Definition.AnswerEn: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas face challenges like ecological environment degradation, including the drying up of rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, intensification of land desertification, and frequent dust storms. These issues are particularly prevalent in regions along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin and the Aral Sea basin.
Definition.AnswerCn: 内陆河流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境恶化的挑战，包括河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及频繁的沙尘暴。这些问题在丝绸之路沿线地区尤为突出，例如塔里木河流域和咸海流域。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What can be inferred about the ecological balance in oasis–desert systems from the long-term energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange datasets collected in arid regions?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 从在干旱地区收集的长期能量、水汽和碳交换数据集可以推断出绿洲-沙漠系统中的生态平衡。
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The datasets from oasis–desert systems provide insights into the balance between these ecosystems, which is critical for sustainable oasis development. By understanding the exchange of energy, water vapor, and carbon, researchers can assess the interactions within these systems, which is significant for protecting ecological stability and supporting socioeconomic development.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 来自绿洲-沙漠系统的数据集提供了对这些生态系统之间平衡的洞察，这对可持续绿洲发展至关重要。通过了解能量、水蒸气和碳的交换，研究人员可以评估这些系统内的相互作用，这对保护生态稳定性和支持社会经济发展具有重要意义。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How do the data collection methods, such as the use of eddy covariance systems and automatic weather stations, contribute to understanding the carbon balance in arid regions?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 数据收集方法，如涡度协方差系统和自动气象站，如何有助于理解干旱地区的碳平衡？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The use of eddy covariance systems and automatic weather stations helps acquire precise measurements of turbulent fluxes and hydrometeorological data, which are essential for understanding the carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas. These methods allow for detailed observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes, facilitating a quantitative understanding of the carbon balance in these regions.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差系统和自动气象站的使用有助于获取湍流通量和水文气象数据的精确测量，这对于理解绿洲-沙漠地区的碳交换至关重要。这些方法允许对能量、水蒸气和碳通量进行详细观察，从而促进对这些地区碳平衡的定量理解。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What potential challenges might arise in maintaining data quality and consistency for long-term observations in oasis–desert ecosystems, and how are these addressed?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在维持绿洲-沙漠生态系统长期观察的数据质量和一致性方面，可能会出现哪些潜在挑战，以及如何应对这些挑战？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Challenges in maintaining data quality for long-term observations include dealing with missing data, repeated records, and data that exceed physical or instrumental limits. These are addressed through rigorous data processing and quality control measures, such as marking missing data, removing duplicates, and identifying questionable data, to ensure the reliability and consistency of the datasets.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 维护长期观测数据质量的挑战包括处理缺失数据、重复记录以及超出物理或仪器限制的数据。这些问题通过严格的数据处理和质量控制措施来解决，例如标记缺失数据、删除重复项和识别可疑数据，以确保数据集的可靠性和一致性。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes challenges in maintaining the quality and completeness of meteorological datasets in oasis–desert systems?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，维护气象数据集的质量和完整性面临哪些挑战？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas face ecological environment degradation, which includes the drying up of rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, intensification of land desertification, and frequent dust storms. These factors can impact data collection in oasis–desert systems, leading to challenges in maintaining dataset quality and completeness.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化，包括河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及频繁的沙尘暴。这些因素可能会影响绿洲-沙漠系统中的数据收集，导致维护数据集质量和完整性面临挑战。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it important to achieve a balance between oasis and desert systems in data collection for sustainable oasis development?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在可持续绿洲发展中，实现绿洲和沙漠系统之间的数据收集平衡是重要的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Achieving a balance between oasis and desert systems is crucial to support ecological security and sustainable development. A quantitative understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in these ecosystems helps in recognizing oasis–desert interactions, which is significant for protecting ecological stability and socioeconomic development.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在绿洲与沙漠系统之间实现平衡对于支持生态安全和可持续发展至关重要。对这些生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解有助于认识绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用，这对保护生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What are the reasons for using long-term observational datasets in studying oasis–desert ecosystems?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在研究绿洲-沙漠生态系统时，使用长期观测数据集的原因有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Long-term observational datasets are indispensable for understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems. They provide crucial insights into oasis–desert interactions and support goals like carbon peaking and carbon neutrality, essential for ecological and economic stability.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 长期观测数据集对于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征至关重要。它们提供了关于绿洲-沙漠相互作用的重要见解，并支持碳达峰和碳中和等目标，这对生态和经济稳定至关重要。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential consequences of implementing long-term observational datasets in the understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中实施长期观测数据集对能量、水蒸气和碳交换理解的潜在后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Implementing long-term observational datasets can provide a quantitative understanding of the interactions within oasis–desert ecosystems, supporting ecological stability and socioeconomic development by informing sustainable oasis development and helping achieve carbon neutrality goals.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 实施长期观测数据集可以提供对绿洲-沙漠生态系统内部相互作用的定量理解，支持生态稳定和社会经济发展，通过为可持续绿洲发展提供信息，帮助实现碳中和目标。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How does the use of automated weather stations with a 10-minute average period impact the quality and comprehensiveness of hydrometeorological data in arid and semiarid regions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用10分钟平均周期的自动气象站对干旱和半干旱地区水文气象数据的质量和全面性有何影响？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The use of automated weather stations with a 10-minute average period enhances the quality and comprehensiveness of hydrometeorological data by providing detailed and consistent observations necessary for understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes, which are crucial for monitoring oasis–desert interactions.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用10分钟平均周期的自动气象站提高了水文气象数据的质量和全面性，提供了详细且一致的观测数据，这对于理解能量、水汽和碳通量至关重要，尤其是在监测绿洲-沙漠相互作用方面。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems when creating datasets about these regions?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在创建关于这些地区的数据集时，保持绿洲和沙漠系统之间的平衡是重要的原因是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: It is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems to achieve sustainable oasis development. Understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems supports the goals of carbon peaking and neutrality, and promotes ecological security and sustainable development.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 保持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续的绿洲发展至关重要。理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水汽和碳交换，有助于实现碳达峰和碳中和的目标，促进生态安全和可持续发展。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are implemented to ensure the quality and reliability of data collected from meteorological stations in arid and semi-arid regions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 为了确保从干旱和半干旱地区的气象站收集的数据的质量和可靠性，实施了哪些程序？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The data processing and quality control procedures involve ensuring a consistent data collection rate, specifically collecting 144 data points per day at 10-minute intervals. Missing data are marked with a specific placeholder (-6999), duplicate records are removed, and any data points that fall outside of the instrument's physical range are deleted. Questionable data are highlighted in red, and date and time formats are standardized.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 数据处理和质量控制程序涉及确保一致的数据收集速率，具体为每天收集144个数据点，间隔为10分钟。缺失的数据用特定的占位符（-6999）标记，重复记录被删除，任何超出仪器物理范围的数据点将被删除。可疑数据用红色突出显示，日期和时间格式被标准化。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What methodologies are used to integrate multiple types of environmental data to assess ecosystem interactions in oasis–desert systems?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 用于整合多种类型环境数据以评估绿洲-沙漠系统中生态系统相互作用的方法论有哪些？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems include energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes, along with auxiliary hydrometeorological, vegetation, and soil data. These are acquired through an eddy covariance system, scintillometer, and automatic weather stations. The integration involves collecting data on radiation, soil heat flux, temperature profiles, air and soil moisture, precipitation, and additional vegetation and soil parameters.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 来自人工和自然绿洲-沙漠系统的观测数据集包括能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及辅助的水文气象、植被和土壤数据。这些数据通过涡度协方差系统、闪烁仪和自动气象站获取。集成过程涉及收集辐射、土壤热通量、温度剖面、空气和土壤湿度、降水以及其他植被和土壤参数的数据。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What observational technologies enable the comprehensive monitoring of meteorological elements in arid and semiarid regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些观测技术能够在干旱和半干旱地区全面监测气象要素？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Observational technologies such as automatic weather stations, eddy covariance systems, and scintillometers enable the comprehensive monitoring of meteorological elements. These technologies facilitate the observation of variables including air temperature, humidity, wind speed, direction, and soil parameters. They are crucial for studying energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges in oasis-desert systems.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 观测技术如自动气象站、涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪能够全面监测气象要素。这些技术促进了对空气温度、湿度、风速、风向和土壤参数等变量的观察。它们对于研究绿洲-沙漠系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换至关重要。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might researchers expect challenges in collecting comprehensive data on energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 研究人员可能会预期在收集关于绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的综合数据时面临挑战。
Expectation.AnswerEn: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频繁发生。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What could be the reasons for expecting long-term observations as essential in understanding the interactions within oasis–desert ecosystems?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 期待长期观察在理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统内相互作用方面至关重要的原因可能包括：
Expectation.AnswerEn: A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠相互作用至关重要，并且对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might there be an expectation for using advanced data collection methods, such as eddy covariance systems and scintillometers, in studies of oasis–desert systems?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在对绿洲-沙漠系统的研究中，使用先进的数据收集方法，如涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪，可能会有这样的期望。
Expectation.AnswerEn: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据是通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取的。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How would you evaluate the effectiveness of using automated weather stations for collecting hydrometeorological data in arid and semi-arid regions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 如何评估在干旱和半干旱地区使用自动气象站收集水文气象数据的有效性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Automated weather stations are effective in providing continuous and detailed observations, such as air temperature, humidity, wind speed and direction, soil moisture, and radiation. The dataset from the 黑河流域地表过程综合观测网 shows that these stations can reliably collect high-frequency data necessary for understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert systems.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 自动气象站在提供连续和详细的观测方面非常有效，例如空气温度、湿度、风速和风向、土壤湿度以及辐射。来自黑河流域地表过程综合观测网的数据集表明，这些站点能够可靠地收集理解绿洲-沙漠系统中能量、水汽和碳交换所需的高频数据。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What are the potential challenges in maintaining data quality and accuracy in long-term environmental observations in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，维护长期环境观测的数据质量和准确性可能面临的挑战有哪些？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Challenges include ensuring the completeness of data, calibrating instruments to prevent drift, and identifying and removing data that are physically implausible or outside instrument ranges. The 黑河流域地表过程综合观测网 dataset addresses these challenges by marking missing data, excluding duplicates, and flagging dubious records.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 挑战包括确保数据的完整性、校准仪器以防止漂移，以及识别和去除物理上不合理或超出仪器范围的数据。黑河流域地表过程综合观测网数据集通过标记缺失数据、排除重复数据和标记可疑记录来应对这些挑战。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't figure out how the data collection methods are adapted to handle the challenges posed by arid and semiarid regions in oasis-desert ecosystems.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法弄清楚数据收集方法是如何适应绿洲-沙漠生态系统中干旱和半干旱地区所带来的挑战的。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The data collection methods involve the use of automatic weather stations to gather hydrometeorological data with a 10-minute average period. These stations are equipped to observe radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, air temperature and humidity gradients, wind speed and direction, air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles. Additionally, eddy covariance systems and scintillometers acquire turbulent flux data, which are crucial for understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges in these challenging environments.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 数据收集方法涉及使用自动气象站收集水文气象数据，平均周期为10分钟。这些气象站能够观察辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面、空气温度和湿度梯度、风速和风向、气压、降水量以及土壤湿度剖面。此外，涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取湍流通量数据，这对于理解这些复杂环境中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换至关重要。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how long-term observations can effectively contribute to achieving sustainable development in oasis-desert systems.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白长期观察如何有效地促进绿洲-沙漠系统的可持续发展。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Long-term observations are critical for gaining a quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange processes in oasis-desert ecosystems. This understanding helps in recognizing oasis-desert interactions and is significant for protecting ecological stability and supporting socioeconomic development, which are essential for sustainable oasis development and achieving goals like carbon peaking and carbon neutrality.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 长期观测对于深入理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水汽和碳交换过程至关重要。这种理解有助于识别绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用，并对保护生态稳定性和支持社会经济发展具有重要意义，这对于可持续的绿洲发展以及实现碳达峰和碳中和等目标是必不可少的。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I am unsure about how datasets from oasis-desert systems can be effectively processed and quality-controlled given the complex environmental conditions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不确定如何有效处理和质量控制来自绿洲-沙漠系统的数据集，因为环境条件复杂。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The datasets are processed and quality-controlled through a systematic procedure involving data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing. The quality control steps include ensuring complete data capture, removing duplicates, deleting data that exceeds physical or instrumental limits, and marking questionable data. This rigorous approach is crucial to ensure the reliability and utility of the data collected from complex oasis-desert environments.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 这些数据集通过一个系统的程序进行处理和质量控制，包括数据收集、数据处理以及数据归档和共享。质量控制步骤包括确保数据完整捕获、去除重复数据、删除超过物理或仪器限制的数据，以及标记可疑数据。这种严格的方法对于确保从复杂的绿洲-沙漠环境中收集的数据的可靠性和实用性至关重要。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please outline the data collection methods used in assembling a dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas, and discuss the types of instrumentation involved.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请概述在收集绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集时使用的数据收集方法，并讨论所涉及的仪器类型。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The data collection methods involve using automatic weather stations with a 10-minute average period, which measure radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, gradients of air temperature and humidity, wind speed and direction, air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles. Additionally, eddy covariance systems and scintillometers are used to acquire half-hourly turbulent flux data. These methods provide long-term energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes, along with auxiliary hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 数据收集方法包括使用自动气象站，采用10分钟平均周期，测量辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面、空气温度和湿度梯度、风速和风向、气压、降水量以及土壤湿度剖面。此外，还使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取半小时的湍流通量数据。这些方法提供长期的能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及辅助的水文气象、植被和土壤参数。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please conduct a search for potential datasets that provide insights into the hydrometeorological parameters of oasis–desert systems, including vegetation and soil characteristics, and discuss the availability of these datasets.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请搜索潜在的数据集，这些数据集提供关于绿洲-沙漠系统的水文气象参数的见解，包括植被和土壤特征，并讨论这些数据集的可用性。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Potential datasets that provide insights into the hydrometeorological parameters of oasis–desert systems include those reported for the middle and lower reaches of the HRB in western China. These datasets, which are available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center, include energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes, hydrometeorological data, as well as vegetation and soil parameters. They comprise data collected from 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations established since 2012.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 潜在的数据集可以提供关于绿洲-沙漠系统的水文气象参数的洞察，包括在中国西部的河西走廊中下游地区报告的数据。这些数据集可从国家西藏高原数据中心获取，包含能量、水汽和碳通量、水文气象数据，以及植被和土壤参数。数据来自自2012年以来建立的11个地表通量和气象站收集的数据。
